H0.text: What 'rare' noble gas element used in lighting was discovered in 1898 and named after Greek 'new'. Argon

H1.text: What 'rare' noble gas element used in lighting was discovered in 1898 and named after Greek 'new'. Krypton

H2.text: What 'rare' noble gas element used in lighting was discovered in 1898 and named after Greek 'new'. Xenon

H3.text: What 'rare' noble gas element used in lighting was discovered in 1898 and named after Greek 'new'. Neon

A4.text: Neon was discovered in 1898 by the British chemists Sir William Ramsay and Morris Travers in London.

A5.text: The name 'neon' comes from the Greek word νέον, a neuter singular form of νέος (neos), meaning 'new'.
